content: Which American inventor is known for his contributions to the development of the telegraph and the Morse code?

The American inventor you're referring to is Samuel F.B. Morse. He played a pivotal role in the development of the telegraph, which revolutionized long-distance communication in the 19th century. Additionally, he invented Morse code, a method of transmitting textual information as a series of on-off tones, lights, or clicks that correspond to the letters of the alphabet. This code is still used today in various forms of communication.
